spirit evaporates; and not having the just ties, affectation disgusts,
when grace was expected to charm. Those composed compositions only have
power to delight, and carry us willing captives, where the soul of the
author is exhibited, and animates the hidden springs. The female
organs have been thought too weak for this arduous employment; and
experience seems to justify the assertion. Without arguing physically
about _possibilities_--in a fiction, such a being may be allowed to
exist; whose grandeur is derived from the operations of its own faculties, not subjugated to opinion; but
drawn by the individual from the original source.
